summary: Wanted to be an angry ghost? Now you can.
descriptionHtml:
--- What's this about?
It's a little thing I originally made for myself, but I thought others could use it too. It adds a power and an ability that will let you play as an angry ghost. It looks and works the same as Malkoran's shade, meaning that you'll move like a dragon priest and you can't jump or use weapons other than staves.
The ability is optional and will give you the standard undead passives, meaning a weakness to fire and immunity to poison* and disease.
This mod requires Dawnguard.

Some of the abilities while transformed depend on your progress throughout the game:
- At the start of the game, you'll be a very easy target until you progress far enough.
- The same will happen in the Soul Cairn due to having your soul trapped. Don't pick the vampire route, vampires are [color=#ff0000][b]not[/b][/color] supported. This also means that you're forced to side with the Dawnguard unless you want to cure your vampirism all the time.
- The transformation bonuses are leveled. They're barely noticeable initially, but you'll become a much harder nut to crack as you level up.
Don't worry about having the resilience of toilet paper without knowing it. It will be stated explicitly.

As a bonus, sneaking while in wraith form will give you that cool dragon priest spell juggling animation.
* poison resistance is hard-capped by the game. Poisons will unfortunately still affect you, but will be much weaker.

--- Installation
1) Pick the file matching the race you intend to play.
2) Use NMM or MO to unpack it, redo your patches if you have to.
3) player.addspell xx00081a for the transformation power. xx is this mod's number in your load order.
3) player.addspell xx002fbc if you want the passives as well.
This is a scripted mod, so don't even think about installing it in the middle of a playthrough. It should work anyway, but it's your problem if something goes wrong.

--- Uninstallation
Don't. It's a scripted mod. You don't remove scripted mods unless you're starting a new character from the main menu. If you hate it that much, remove the spells with the console.

--- FAQ
Q: Is this compatible with [mod]?
A: It should be, I haven't found any conflicts yet.

Q: Does this support custom races? / Does this work with vampires?
A: Forget it. It was enough of a hassle to make it work as it is.

Q: Why does my game crash every other time I transform?
A: Welcome to Skyrim. What, you thought you could play with awesome mods and get away with it? The engine knows no mercy. And no, this can't be fixed, not by me, not by anyone.

Q: Why can't I do anything after I change spells?
A: NPCs don't equip spells the way you do, and the game makes it obvious with monster races. If you switch the spell in either hand, you'll have to unequip the left hand, close the menu, open it again and re-equip the left hand. It doesn't happen if you leave your right hand empty.

Q: Will the bonuses eventually become lame and useless?
A: Depends on your definition of it. The buffs will scale up to level 90. I tried to make them balanced.

Q: Can I be a glorious floating specter without everyone hating me?
A: Type 'set WraithIsPublicEnemy to 0' in the console before transforming. Also takes off a good bit of the script load. Recommended in script-heavy fights.

Q: Will you add super duper new stuff? / Can you add/change X?
A: Nope, at least for the time being. Like I said at the top, this was never even meant to be uploaded.

Q: I installed this mod, now my game crashes every three nanoseconds and my computer wants to kill me. Is this your fault, you filthy saboteur?
A: No.
author: InfiniteSource
